translations.idiomatic: They conspired to accompany the duke on a tour of the bamboo grove. The two men assassinated Duke Yi right on his carriage, abandoned his body in the bamboo grove, and fled.

sentences.zh: 懿公之立，驕，民不附。

translations.literal: Yi Gong's establishment, arrogant, people not attached.
translations.idiomatic: During Duke Yi's reign, he was arrogant and the people did not support him.

sentences.zh: 齊人廢其子而迎公子元於衛，立之，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Qi people deposed his son and welcomed prince Yuan from Wei, established him, this was Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi deposed Duke Yi's son and went to Wei to welcome Prince Yuan, installing him as ruler, who became Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公，桓公子也。

translations.literal: Hui Gong, Huan Gong's son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui was a son of Duke Huan.

sentences.zh: 其母衛女，曰少衛姬，避齊亂，故在衛。

translations.literal: His mother Wei woman, called Younger Wei Ji, avoided Qi chaos, therefore in Wei.
translations.idiomatic: His mother was a woman from Wei, called Younger Lady Wei. She had fled to Wei to avoid the chaos in Qi.

sentences.zh: 惠公二年，長翟來，王子城父攻殺之，埋之於北門。

translations.literal: Hui Gong second year, Chang Di came, Wang Zi Cheng Fu attacked and killed him, buried him at north gate.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's second year, the Changdi barbarians came. Wang Zi Cheng Fu attacked and killed them, burying the bodies at the north gate.

sentences.zh: 晉趙穿弒其君靈公。

translations.literal: Jin Zhao Chuan assassinated his ruler Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Chuan of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 十年，惠公卒，子頃公無野立。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Hui Gong died, son Qing Gong Wu Ye established.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Hui died and his son Duke Qing (Wu Ye) succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 初，崔杼有寵於惠公，惠公卒，高、國畏其偪也，逐之，崔杼奔衛。

translations.literal: Initially, Cui Zhu had favor with Hui Gong, Hui Gong died, Gao, Guo feared his oppression, drove him out, Cui Zhu fled to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, Cui Zhu was favored by Duke Hui. After Duke Hui's death, Gao Xi and Guo feared Cui Zhu's overbearing influence and drove him out. Cui Zhu fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 頃公元年，楚莊王彊，伐陳；

translations.literal: Qing Gong first year, Chu Zhuang Wang strong, attacked Chen;
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's first year, King Zhuang of Chu was powerful and attacked Chen;

sentences.zh: 二年，圍鄭，鄭伯降，已復國鄭伯。

translations.literal: Second year, besieged Zheng, Zheng Bo surrendered, then restored Zheng Bo's state.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, Chu besieged Zheng. The Marquis of Zheng surrendered, but Chu then restored his state to him.

sentences.zh: 六年春，晉使郤克於齊，齊使夫人帷中而觀之。

translations.literal: Sixth year spring, Jin sent Xi Ke to Qi, Qi made wife observe him from behind curtains.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the sixth year, Jin sent Xi Ke as envoy to Qi. Qi had their consort observe him from behind a curtain.

sentences.zh: 郤克上，夫人笑之。

translations.literal: Xi Ke ascended, wife laughed at him.
translations.idiomatic: As Xi Ke climbed the steps, the consort laughed at him.

sentences.zh: 郤克曰：「不是報，不復涉河！」

translations.literal: Xi Ke said: 'If not revenge, will not again cross river!'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke declared: 'If I don't avenge this insult, I will never cross the Yellow River again!'

sentences.zh: 歸，請伐齊，晉侯弗許。

translations.literal: Returned, requested attack Qi, Jin Hou did not permit.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning to Jin, Xi Ke requested permission to attack Qi, but the Marquis of Jin refused.

sentences.zh: 齊使至晉，郤克執齊使者四人河內，殺之。

translations.literal: Qi envoy arrived at Jin, Xi Ke seized four Qi envoys south of river, killed them.
translations.idiomatic: When Qi envoys arrived in Jin, Xi Ke seized four of them south of the Yellow River and executed them.

sentences.zh: 八年。

translations.literal: Eighth year.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year:

sentences.zh: 晉伐齊，齊以公子彊質晉，晉兵去。

translations.literal: Jin attacked Qi, Qi sent prince Qiang as hostage to Jin, Jin troops departed.
translations.idiomatic: Jin attacked Qi. Qi sent Prince Qiang as a hostage to Jin, and the Jin forces withdrew.

sentences.zh: 十年春，齊伐魯、衛。

translations.literal: Tenth year spring, Qi attacked Lu, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of the tenth year, Qi attacked Lu and Wei.

sentences.zh: 魯、衛大夫如晉請師，皆因郤克。

translations.literal: Lu, Wei grand officers went to Jin requested troops, all relied on Xi Ke.
translations.idiomatic: Ministers from Lu and Wei went to Jin requesting military aid, and all approached Xi Ke.

sentences.zh: 晉使郤克以車八百乘為中軍將，士燮將上軍，欒書將下軍，以救魯、衛，伐齊。

translations.literal: Jin sent Xi Ke with eight hundred chariots as central army general, Shi Xie general of upper army, Luan Shu general of lower army, to rescue Lu, Wei, attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Jin appointed Xi Ke as commander of the central army with 800 chariots, Shi Xie as commander of the upper army, and Luan Shu as commander of the lower army, to rescue Lu and Wei by attacking Qi.

sentences.zh: 六月壬申，與齊侯兵合靡笄下。

translations.literal: Sixth month ren shen, with Qi Hou troops joined at Mi Ji below.
translations.idiomatic: On the ren shen day of the sixth month, the Jin forces joined battle with Duke Qing of Qi's army below Mi Ji Hill.

sentences.zh: 癸酉，陳于礱逄丑父為齊頃公右。

translations.literal: Gui you, arrayed at Long, Pang Chou Fu as Qi Qing Gong's right.
translations.idiomatic: On gui you, the battle lines formed at Long Hill, with Pang Chou Fu serving as Duke Qing of Qi's chariot driver.

sentences.zh: 頃公曰：「馳之，破晉軍會食。」

translations.literal: Qing Gong said: 'Charge them, break Jin army will gather to eat.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing commanded: 'Charge! Break the Jin army and we'll dine together on the victory.'

sentences.zh: 射傷郤克，流血至履。

translations.literal: Shot wounded Xi Ke, blood flowed to shoes.
translations.idiomatic: An arrow wounded Xi Ke, and blood flowed down to his shoes.

sentences.zh: 克欲還入壁，其御曰：「我始入，再傷，不敢言疾，恐懼士卒，願子忍之。」

translations.literal: Ke wished to return enter fortifications, his charioteer said: 'I begin enter, twice wounded, dare not speak pain, fear terrify soldiers, wish you endure it.'
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke wanted to retreat into the fortifications, but his charioteer said: 'When we first entered battle, you were wounded twice. I didn't dare mention your pain, fearing it would demoralize the troops. Please endure it.'

sentences.zh: 遂復戰。

translations.literal: Therefore again fought.
translations.idiomatic: So they resumed fighting.

sentences.zh: 戰，齊急，丑父恐齊侯得，乃易處，頃公為右，車絓於木而止。

translations.literal: Fought, Qi urgent, Chou Fu feared Qi Hou captured, therefore changed positions, Qing Gong became right, chariot caught on wood and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: In the heat of battle, the Qi forces were in dire straits. Chou Fu feared Duke Qing would be captured, so he switched positions with him, making the duke his charioteer. The chariot then caught on a tree and stopped.

sentences.zh: 晉小將韓厥伏齊侯車前，曰「寡君使臣救魯、衛」，戲之。

translations.literal: Jin young general Han Jue hid Qi Hou chariot front, said 'my lord sent minister rescue Lu, Wei', mocked him.
translations.idiomatic: The young Jin general Han Jue hid in front of Duke Qing's chariot and taunted him: 'My lord sent me to rescue Lu and Wei,' and mocked him.

sentences.zh: 丑父使頃公下取飲，因得亡，脫去，入其軍。

translations.literal: Chou Fu made Qing Gong descend fetch drink, thereby got to flee, escaped away, entered his army.
translations.idiomatic: Chou Fu ordered Duke Qing to dismount and fetch water. While he was gone, Chou Fu escaped in the chariot and rejoined the Qi army.

sentences.zh: 晉郤克欲殺丑父。

translations.literal: Jin Xi Ke wished to kill Chou Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke of Jin wanted to execute Chou Fu.

sentences.zh: 丑父曰：「代君死而見僇，後人臣無忠其君者矣。」

translations.literal: Chou Fu said: 'Substitute death for lord and be mutilated, later ministers none loyal to their lords.'
translations.idiomatic: Chou Fu said: 'If I am executed for taking my lord's place in death, future ministers will have no reason to be loyal to their lords.'

sentences.zh: 克捨之，丑父遂得亡歸齊。

translations.literal: Ke released him, Chou Fu therefore got to flee return to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Xi Ke released him, and Chou Fu was able to escape back to Qi.

sentences.zh: 於是晉軍追齊至馬陵。

translations.literal: Therefore Jin army pursued Qi to Ma Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin army then pursued the Qi forces all the way to Ma Ling.

sentences.zh: 齊侯請以寶器謝，不聽；

translations.literal: Qi Hou requested with precious vessels apologize, not listened;
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing of Qi offered precious vessels as compensation, but Jin refused.

sentences.zh: 必得笑克者蕭桐叔子，令齊東畝。

translations.literal: Must obtain the one who laughed at Ke Xiao Tong Shu Zi, make Qi eastern fields.
translations.idiomatic: Jin demanded the woman who had laughed at Xi Ke—Xiao Tong Shu Zi—and also wanted Qi to cede its eastern territories.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「叔子，齊君母。

translations.literal: Replied: 'Shu Zi, Qi jun mother.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi representative replied: 'Shu Zi is the mother of our ruler.

sentences.zh: 齊君母亦猶晉君母，子安置之？

translations.literal: Qi jun mother also like Jin jun mother, son how place it?'
translations.idiomatic: The mother of our ruler is just like the mother of your ruler. How would you handle it?'

sentences.zh: 且子以義伐而以暴為後，其可乎？」

translations.literal: Moreover you with righteousness attack but with violence as consequence, can it?'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, you attacked us claiming righteous cause, but now follow up with violence. Is this acceptable?'

sentences.zh: 於是乃許，令反魯、衛之侵地。

translations.literal: Therefore then permitted, ordered return Lu, Wei's invaded lands.
translations.idiomatic: Jin finally agreed and ordered the return of the territories taken from Lu and Wei.

sentences.zh: 十一年，晉初置六卿，賞鞌之功。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Jin first established six ministers, rewarded An battle merit.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Jin first established the six ministerial houses, rewarding those who had served at the Battle of An.

sentences.zh: 齊頃公朝晉，欲尊王晉景公，晉景公不敢受，乃歸。

translations.literal: Qi Qing Gong paid court to Jin, wished to honor king Jin Jing Gong, Jin Jing Gong dared not accept, therefore returned.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Qing of Qi went to Jin to pay homage and wanted to bestow royal honors on Duke Jing of Jin. Duke Jing did not dare accept them, so Duke Qing returned home.

sentences.zh: 歸而頃公弛苑囿，薄賦斂，振孤問疾，虛積聚以救民，民亦大說。

translations.literal: Returned and Qing Gong relaxed gardens parks, lightened taxes levies, relieved orphans inquired illnesses, emptied granaries to save people, people also greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning, Duke Qing opened up the royal gardens and parks, reduced taxes and levies, provided relief to orphans and visited the ill, and distributed grain reserves to aid the people. The people were greatly pleased.

sentences.zh: 厚禮諸侯。

translations.literal: Generous ceremony to feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: He treated the feudal lords with generous courtesy.

sentences.zh: 竟頃公卒，百姓附，諸侯不犯。

translations.literal: Finally Qing Gong died, common people attached, feudal lords not violated.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Qing finally died, the common people were devoted to him, and no feudal lord dared attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 十七年，頃公卒，子靈公環立。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Qing Gong died, son Ling Gong Huan established.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Duke Qing died and his son Duke Ling (Huan) succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 靈公九年，晉欒書弒其君厲公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong ninth year, Jin Luan Shu assassinated his ruler Li Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ling's ninth year, Luan Shu of Jin assassinated his ruler Duke Li.

sentences.zh: 十年，晉悼公伐齊，齊令公子光質晉。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Jin Dao Gong attacked Qi, Qi ordered prince Guang hostage Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Duke Dao of Jin attacked Qi, and Qi sent Prince Guang as a hostage to Jin.

sentences.zh: 十九年，立子光為太子，高厚傅之，令會諸侯盟於鐘離。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, established son Guang as crown prince, Gao Hou instructed him, ordered assemble feudal lords ally at Zhong Li.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Duke Ling established his son Guang as crown prince, with Gao Hou as his tutor, and ordered him to convene the feudal lords for an alliance at Zhong Li.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，晉使中行獻子伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Jin sent Zhong Xing Xian Zi attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Jin sent Zhong Xing Xian Zi to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊師敗，靈公走入臨菑。

translations.literal: Qi army defeated, Ling Gong fled entered Linzi.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi army was defeated, and Duke Ling fled into Linzi.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰止靈公，靈公弗從。

translations.literal: Yan Ying stopped Ling Gong, Ling Gong did not follow.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying tried to stop Duke Ling, but the duke refused.

sentences.zh: 曰：「君亦無勇矣！」

translations.literal: Said: 'Lord also no courage!'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying said: 'My lord has no courage either!'

sentences.zh: 晉兵遂圍臨菑，臨菑城守不敢出，晉焚郭中而去。

translations.literal: Jin troops then surrounded Linzi, Linzi city defenders dared not come out, Jin burned suburbs and departed.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin troops then surrounded Linzi. The city defenders dared not sally forth, so Jin burned the suburbs and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，初，靈公取魯女，生子光，以為太子。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, initially, Ling Gong took Lu woman, gave birth to son Guang, established as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year: originally, Duke Ling married a woman from Lu who bore him a son named Guang, whom he established as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 仲姬，戎姬。

translations.literal: Zhong Ji, Rong Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ji and Rong Ji.

sentences.zh: 戎姬嬖，仲姬生子牙，屬之戎姬。

translations.literal: Rong Ji favored, Zhong Ji gave birth to son Ya, entrusted him to Rong Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Rong Ji was favored, and when Zhong Ji gave birth to a son named Ya, she entrusted him to Rong Ji's care.

sentences.zh: 戎姬請以為太子，公許之。

translations.literal: Rong Ji requested establish as crown prince, duke permitted it.
translations.idiomatic: Rong Ji requested that Ya be established as crown prince, and the duke agreed.

sentences.zh: 仲姬曰：「不可。

translations.literal: Zhong Ji said: 'Cannot.
translations.idiomatic: Zhong Ji said: 'This cannot be done.

sentences.zh: 光之立，列於諸侯矣，今無故廢之，君必悔之。」

translations.literal: Guang's establishment, ranked among feudal lords, now without cause depose him, lord certainly regret it.'
translations.idiomatic: Guang's status as crown prince is already recognized among the feudal lords. To depose him without cause—my lord will certainly regret this.'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「在我耳。」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'In my ears.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke replied: 'It's up to me.'

sentences.zh: 遂東太子光，使高厚傅牙為太子。

translations.literal: Therefore exiled crown prince Guang east, made Gao Hou instruct Ya as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: So Duke Ling exiled Crown Prince Guang to the east and had Gao Hou tutor Ya as the new crown prince.

sentences.zh: 靈公疾，崔杼迎故太子光而立之，是為莊公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong ill, Cui Zhu welcomed former crown prince Guang and established him, this was Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Ling fell ill, Cui Zhu welcomed the former Crown Prince Guang back and installed him as ruler, who became Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 莊公殺戎姬。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong killed Rong Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang executed Rong Ji.

sentences.zh: 五月壬辰，靈公卒，莊公即位，執太子牙於句竇之丘，殺之。

translations.literal: Fifth month ren chen, Ling Gong died, Zhuang Gong ascended throne, seized crown prince Ya at Gou Dou hill, killed him.
translations.idiomatic: On the ren chen day of the fifth month, Duke Ling died. Duke Zhuang ascended the throne, seized the crown prince Ya at Gou Dou Hill, and executed him.

sentences.zh: 八月，崔杼殺高厚。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Cui Zhu killed Gao Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Cui Zhu assassinated Gao Hou.

sentences.zh: 晉聞齊亂，伐齊，至高唐。

translations.literal: Jin heard Qi chaos, attacked Qi, arrived at Gao Tang.
translations.idiomatic: Jin, hearing of the disorder in Qi, attacked Qi and reached Gao Tang.

sentences.zh: 莊公三年，晉大夫欒盈奔齊，莊公厚客待之。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong third year, Jin grand officer Luan Ying fled to Qi, Zhuang Gong generously hosted him.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhuang's third year, the Jin minister Luan Ying fled to Qi, and Duke Zhuang generously entertained him.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰、田文子諫，公弗聽。

translations.literal: Yan Ying, Tian Wen Zi admonished, duke did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying and Tian Wen Zi advised against it, but the duke refused to listen.

sentences.zh: 四年，齊莊公使欒盈閒入晉曲沃為內應，以兵隨之，上太行，入孟門。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Qi Zhuang Gong sent Luan Ying secretly enter Jin Qu Wo as internal support, with troops following, ascended Tai Hang, entered Meng Gate.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Duke Zhuang of Qi sent Luan Ying to secretly enter Qu Wo in Jin as an internal ally, with Qi troops following. They ascended Tai Hang Mountain and entered Meng Gate.

sentences.zh: 欒盈敗，齊兵還，取朝歌。

translations.literal: Luan Ying defeated, Qi troops returned, took Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: Luan Ying was defeated, and the Qi troops retreated, capturing Zhao Ge on the way.

sentences.zh: 六年，初，棠公妻好，棠公死，崔杼取之。

translations.literal: Sixth year, initially, Tang Gong wife beautiful, Tang Gong died, Cui Zhu took her.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year: originally, the wife of Duke Tang was beautiful. After Duke Tang died, Cui Zhu married her.

sentences.zh: 莊公通之，數如崔氏，以崔杼之冠賜人。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong had relations with her, frequently went to Cui family, with Cui Zhu's hat bestowed on people.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had an affair with her and frequently visited the Cui residence. He once gave away Cui Zhu's hat to someone else.

sentences.zh: 待者曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: Attendant said: 'Cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: An attendant said: 'This cannot be done.'

sentences.zh: 崔杼怒，因其伐晉，欲與晉合謀襲齊而不得閒。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu angry, took advantage of his attack Jin, wished with Jin jointly plot attack Qi but did not get opportunity.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu was furious. He took advantage of Duke Zhuang's campaign against Jin to conspire with Jin to attack Qi, but could not find the right opportunity.

sentences.zh: 莊公嘗笞宦者賈舉，賈舉復侍，為崔杼閒公以報怨。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong once flogged eunuch Jia Ju, Jia Ju again served, for Cui Zhu spied on duke to avenge grudge.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhuang had once flogged the eunuch Jia Ju. Jia Ju continued to serve and spied on the duke for Cui Zhu to avenge this grudge.

sentences.zh: 五月，莒子朝齊，齊以甲戌饗之。

translations.literal: Fifth month, Ju Zi paid court to Qi, Qi with jia xu feasted him.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, the ruler of Ju paid homage to Qi. Qi hosted a banquet for him on jia xu day.

sentences.zh: 崔杼稱病不視事。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu claimed illness did not attend affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu feigned illness and did not attend to official duties.

sentences.zh: 乙亥，公問崔杼病，遂從崔杼妻。

translations.literal: Yi hai, duke inquired Cui Zhu illness, then followed Cui Zhu wife.
translations.idiomatic: On yi hai day, the duke went to inquire about Cui Zhu's illness, and then went to see Cui Zhu's wife.

sentences.zh: 崔杼妻入室，與崔杼自閉戶不出，公擁柱而歌。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu wife entered room, with Cui Zhu self closed door not came out, duke embraced pillar and sang.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu's wife entered the room and, together with Cui Zhu, locked themselves inside and did not come out. The duke embraced a pillar and sang.

sentences.zh: 宦者賈舉遮公從官而入，閉門，崔杼之徒持兵從中起。

translations.literal: Eunuch Jia Ju blocked duke's following officials and entered, closed door, Cui Zhu's followers held weapons rose from within.
translations.idiomatic: The eunuch Jia Ju blocked the duke's attendants from entering and closed the door. Cui Zhu's followers, armed with weapons, rose up from inside.

sentences.zh: 公登臺而請解，不許；

translations.literal: Duke ascended platform and requested release, not permitted;
translations.idiomatic: The duke climbed onto a platform and pleaded to be released, but was refused.

sentences.zh: 請盟，不許；

translations.literal: Requested covenant, not permitted;
translations.idiomatic: He requested to make a covenant, but was refused.

sentences.zh: 請自殺於廟，不許。

translations.literal: Requested suicide in temple, not permitted.
translations.idiomatic: He requested to commit suicide in the ancestral temple, but was refused.

sentences.zh: 皆曰：「君之臣杼疾病，不能聽命。

translations.literal: All said: 'Lord's minister Zhu ill, cannot obey commands.
translations.idiomatic: They all said: 'Your minister Zhu is ill and cannot obey commands.

sentences.zh: 近於公宮。

translations.literal: Close to duke palace.
translations.idiomatic: He is confined near the ducal palace.

sentences.zh: 陪臣爭趣有淫者，不知二命。」

translations.literal: Minister's followers contend hasten have licentious one, do not know two commands.'
translations.idiomatic: His followers are contending and hastening because there is a licentious one among them. They do not know which of two commands to obey.'

sentences.zh: 公踰墻，射中公股，公反墜，遂弒之。

translations.literal: Duke climbed wall, shot hit duke thigh, duke fell back, then assassinated him.
translations.idiomatic: The duke tried to climb the wall to escape. An arrow struck his thigh, he fell back, and they assassinated him.

sentences.zh: 晏嬰立崔杼門外，曰：「君為社稷死則死之，為社稷亡則亡之。

translations.literal: Yan Ying stood Cui Zhu gate outside, said: 'Lord for altars of soil and grain die then die for him, for altars of soil and grain flee then flee for him.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Ying stood outside Cui Zhu's gate and declared: 'If the lord dies for the altars of soil and grain, then die for him. If he flees for the altars of soil and grain, then flee for him.

sentences.zh: 若為己死己亡，非其私暱，誰敢任之！」

translations.literal: If for self die self flee, not his private favorites, who dares undertake it!'
translations.idiomatic: But if he dies or flees for his own sake, who among those not his private favorites would dare to undertake such a task!'

sentences.zh: 門開而入，枕公尸而哭，三踴而出。

translations.literal: Gate opened and entered, pillowed duke corpse and cried, three times jumped and came out.
translations.idiomatic: The gate opened and he entered. He pillowed the duke's corpse and wept, then leaped three times and departed.

sentences.zh: 人謂崔杼：「必殺之。」

translations.literal: People told Cui Zhu: 'Must kill him.'
translations.idiomatic: People told Cui Zhu: 'You must kill him.'

sentences.zh: 崔杼曰：「民之望也，捨之得民。」

translations.literal: Cui Zhu said: 'People's hope, release him get people.'
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu replied: 'He is the people's hope. Releasing him will win the people's favor.'

sentences.zh: 丁丑，崔杼立莊公異母弟杵臼，是為景公。

translations.literal: Ding chou, Cui Zhu established Zhuang Gong different mother younger brother Chu Jiu, this was Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: On ding chou day, Cui Zhu installed Zhuang Gong's half-brother Chu Jiu as ruler, who became Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 景公母，魯叔孫宣伯女也。

translations.literal: Jing Gong mother, Lu Shu Sun Xuan Bo daughter.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's mother was the daughter of Shu Sun Xuan Bo of Lu.

sentences.zh: 景公立，以崔杼為右相，慶封為左相。

translations.literal: Jing Gong established, with Cui Zhu as right chancellor, Qing Feng as left chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Jing ascended the throne, he appointed Cui Zhu as right chancellor and Qing Feng as left chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二相恐亂起，乃與國人盟曰：「不與崔慶者死！」

translations.literal: Two chancellors feared chaos arise, then with state people covenanted said: 'Not with Cui Qing participate die!'
translations.idiomatic: The two chancellors, fearing that chaos would arise, made a covenant with the people of the state: 'Anyone who does not side with the Cui and Qing families shall die!'

sentences.zh: 晏子仰天曰：「嬰所不（獲）唯忠於君利社稷者是從！」

translations.literal: Yan Zi gazed heaven said: 'Ying what not obtain only loyal to lord benefit altars of soil and grain follow!'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi gazed at heaven and declared: 'I will follow only those who are loyal to the lord and benefit the altars of soil and grain!'

sentences.zh: 不肯盟。

translations.literal: Did not consent to covenant.
translations.idiomatic: He refused to take the covenant.

sentences.zh: 慶封欲殺晏子，崔杼曰：「忠臣也，捨之。」

translations.literal: Qing Feng wished kill Yan Zi, Cui Zhu said: 'Loyal minister, release him.'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng wanted to kill Yan Zi, but Cui Zhu said: 'He is a loyal minister. Let him go.'

sentences.zh: 齊太史書曰「崔杼弒莊公」，崔杼殺之。

translations.literal: Qi grand historian wrote said 'Cui Zhu assassinated Zhuang Gong', Cui Zhu killed him.
translations.idiomatic: The grand historian of Qi wrote: 'Cui Zhu assassinated Duke Zhuang.' Cui Zhu had him killed.

sentences.zh: 其弟復書，崔杼復殺之。

translations.literal: His younger brother again wrote, Cui Zhu again killed him.
translations.idiomatic: His younger brother wrote the same thing, and Cui Zhu killed him too.

sentences.zh: 少弟復書，崔杼乃捨之。

translations.literal: Younger brother again wrote, Cui Zhu then released him.
translations.idiomatic: The youngest brother wrote the same thing, and Cui Zhu finally let him go.

sentences.zh: 景公元年，初，崔杼生子成及彊，其母死，取東郭女，生明。

translations.literal: Jing Gong first year, initially, Cui Zhu gave birth to son Cheng and Qiang, his mother died, took Dong Guo woman, gave birth to Ming.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Jing's first year: originally, Cui Zhu had sons named Cheng and Qiang. Their mother died, so he married a woman from the Dong Guo family who bore him a son named Ming.

sentences.zh: 東郭女使其前夫子無咎與其弟偃相崔氏。

translations.literal: Dong Guo woman made her former husband Zi Wu Jiu and her younger brother Yan assist Cui family.
translations.idiomatic: The Dong Guo woman had her former husband Zi Wu Jiu and her younger brother Yan assist the Cui family.

sentences.zh: 成有罪，二相急治之，立明為太子。

translations.literal: Cheng had crime, two chancellors urgently punished him, established Ming as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: When Cheng committed a crime, the two chancellors severely punished him and established Ming as crown prince instead.

sentences.zh: 成請老於崔［杼］，崔杼許之，二相弗聽，曰：「崔，宗邑，不可。」

translations.literal: Cheng requested retire at Cui, Cui Zhu permitted it, two chancellors did not listen, said: 'Cui, ancestral city, cannot.'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng requested to retire to Cui territory. Cui Zhu agreed, but the two chancellors refused, saying: 'Cui is an ancestral city. This cannot be allowed.'

sentences.zh: 成、彊怒，告慶封。

translations.literal: Cheng, Qiang angry, informed Qing Feng.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng and Qiang, enraged, informed Qing Feng.

sentences.zh: 慶封與崔杼有郤，欲其敗也。

translations.literal: Qing Feng with Cui Zhu had enmity, wished his defeat.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng had enmity with Cui Zhu and wished for his downfall.

sentences.zh: 成、彊殺無咎、偃於崔杼家，家皆奔亡。

translations.literal: Cheng, Qiang killed Wu Jiu, Yan at Cui Zhu home, household all fled away.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng and Qiang killed Wu Jiu and Yan in Cui Zhu's residence. The entire household fled in panic.

sentences.zh: 崔杼怒，無人，使一宦者御，見慶封。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu angry, had no one, made one eunuch drive chariot, saw Qing Feng.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu was furious and had no attendants left. He had a single eunuch drive his chariot to see Qing Feng.

sentences.zh: 慶封曰：「請為子誅之。」

translations.literal: Qing Feng said: 'Please for you execute them.'
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng said: 'I will execute them for you.'

sentences.zh: 使崔杼仇盧蒲嫳攻崔氏，殺成、彊，盡滅崔氏，崔杼婦自殺。

translations.literal: Made Cui Zhu enemy Lu Pu Xian attack Cui family, killed Cheng, Qiang, completely extinguished Cui family, Cui Zhu wife committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Cui Zhu's enemy Lu Pu Xian to attack the Cui family, killing Cheng and Qiang and exterminating the entire Cui clan. Cui Zhu's wife committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 崔杼毋歸，亦自殺。

translations.literal: Cui Zhu had no home to return to, also committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: Cui Zhu had nowhere to return to and committed suicide as well.

sentences.zh: 慶封為相國，專權。

translations.literal: Qing Feng became chancellor, monopolized power.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng became chancellor and monopolized power.

sentences.zh: 三年十月，慶封出獵。

translations.literal: Third year tenth month, Qing Feng went out hunting.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the third year, Qing Feng went out hunting.

sentences.zh: 初，慶封已殺崔杼，益驕，嗜酒好獵，不聽政令。

translations.literal: Initially, Qing Feng already killed Cui Zhu, increasingly arrogant, addicted to wine fond of hunting, did not heed government commands.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, after Qing Feng killed Cui Zhu, he became increasingly arrogant, addicted to wine and hunting, and ignored government affairs.

sentences.zh: 慶舍用政，已有內郤。

translations.literal: Qing She administered government, already had internal enmity.
translations.idiomatic: Qing She administered the government but already had internal enmities.

sentences.zh: 田文子謂桓子曰：「亂將作。」

translations.literal: Tian Wen Zi told Juan Zi said: 'Chaos will arise.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Wen Zi told Juan Zi: 'Chaos is about to break out.'

sentences.zh: 田、鮑、高、欒氏相與謀慶氏。

translations.literal: Tian, Bao, Gao, Luan families mutually plotted against Qing family.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian, Bao, Gao, and Luan families conspired together against the Qing family.

sentences.zh: 慶舍發甲圍慶封宮，四家徒共擊破之。

translations.literal: Qing She dispatched armored troops surrounded Qing Feng palace, four families followers together attacked and broke it.
translations.idiomatic: Qing She dispatched armored troops to surround Qing Feng's palace. The followers of the four families together attacked and broke through.

sentences.zh: 慶封還，不得入，奔魯。

translations.literal: Qing Feng returned, could not enter, fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Qing Feng returned but could not enter his palace, so he fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 齊人讓魯，封奔吳。

translations.literal: Qi people reproached Lu, Feng fled to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi reproached Lu for harboring him, so Qing Feng fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳與之朱方，聚其族而居之，富於在齊。

translations.literal: Wu gave him Zhu Fang, gathered his clan and dwelt there, richer than in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Wu granted him Zhu Fang, where he gathered his clan and settled. He became richer there than he had been in Qi.

sentences.zh: 其秋，齊人徙葬莊公，僇崔杼尸於市以說眾。

translations.literal: That autumn, Qi people moved and buried Zhuang Gong, mutilated Cui Zhu corpse in market to please the multitude.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, the people of Qi moved and reburied Duke Zhuang, and mutilated Cui Zhu's corpse in the marketplace to please the crowd.

sentences.zh: 九年，景公使晏嬰之晉，與叔向私語曰：「齊政卒歸田氏。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Jing Gong sent Yan Ying to Jin, privately spoke with Shu Xiang said: 'Qi government eventually will return to Tian family.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Jing sent Yan Ying to Jin. He privately spoke with Shu Xiang, saying: 'Qi government will eventually go to the Tian family.

sentences.zh: 田氏雖無大德，以公權私，有德於民，民愛之。」

translations.literal: Tian family although has no great virtue, uses public power for private, has virtue toward people, people love them.'
translations.idiomatic: Although the Tian family has no great virtue, they use public power for private gain. They have shown kindness to the people, and the people love them.'

sentences.zh: 十二年，景公如晉，見平公，欲與伐燕。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Jing Gong went to Jin, saw Ping Gong, wished together attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Duke Jing went to Jin and met Duke Ping. He wanted to join in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 十八年，公復如晉，見昭公。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, duke again went to Jin, saw Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, the duke went to Jin again and met Duke Zhao.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，獵魯郊，因入魯，與晏嬰俱問魯禮。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, hunted Lu suburbs, thereby entered Lu, with Yan Ying together inquired Lu rites.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, while hunting in Lu's suburbs, he entered Lu and, together with Yan Ying, inquired about Lu's rituals.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，魯昭公辟季氏難，奔齊。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Lu Zhao Gong avoided Ji family difficulty, fled to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Duke Zhao of Lu fled to Qi to escape difficulties with the Ji family.

sentences.zh: 齊欲以千社封之，子家止昭公，昭公乃請齊伐魯，取鄆以居昭公。

translations.literal: Qi wished with thousand she grant him, Zi Jia stopped Zhao Gong, Zhao Gong then requested Qi attack Lu, take Yun to house Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qi wanted to grant him a thousand villages, but Zi Jia stopped Duke Zhao. Duke Zhao then requested that Qi attack Lu and take Yun for his residence.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, comet appeared.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, a comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 景公坐柏寢，嘆曰：「堂堂！

translations.literal: Jing Gong sat in cypress chamber, sighed said: 'Majestic!
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing sat in the Cypress Chamber and sighed: 'How magnificent!

sentences.zh: 誰有此乎？」

translations.literal: Who has this?'
translations.idiomatic: Who will have this?'

sentences.zh: 群臣皆泣，晏子笑，公怒。

translations.literal: Group ministers all wept, Yan Zi laughed, duke angered.
translations.idiomatic: All the ministers wept, but Yan Zi laughed, which angered the duke.

sentences.zh: 晏子曰：「臣笑群臣諛甚。」

translations.literal: Yan Zi said: 'Minister laughs group ministers flatter extremely.'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi said: 'I laugh because the ministers are flattering you excessively.'

sentences.zh: 景公曰：「彗星出東北，當齊分野，寡人以為憂。」

translations.literal: Jing Gong said: 'Comet comes out northeast, corresponds to Qi star field, I regard as worry.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing said: 'The comet appears in the northeast, which corresponds to Qi's celestial region. I am worried about it.'

sentences.zh: 晏子曰：「君高臺深池，賦斂如弗得，刑罰恐弗勝，茀星將出，彗星何懼乎？」

translations.literal: Yan Zi said: 'Lord high towers deep pools, tax levies as if not obtained, punishments fear not sufficient, Fu star about to appear, comet what fear?'
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi said: 'My lord has high towers and deep pools, exacts taxes as if they are never enough, and punishments that fear they are insufficient. The Fu star is about to appear—what is there to fear from a comet?'

sentences.zh: 公曰：「可禳否？」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'Can avert?'
translations.idiomatic: The duke asked: 'Can it be averted?'

sentences.zh: 晏子曰：「使神可祝而來，亦可禳而去也。

translations.literal: Yan Zi said: 'If spirits can be prayed to come, also can be averted to go.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Zi said: 'If spirits can be summoned by prayer, they can also be driven away by rites.

sentences.zh: 百姓苦怨以萬數，而君令一人禳之，安能勝眾口乎？」

translations.literal: Common people bitter resentment by ten thousands count, and lord orders one person avert it, how can overcome many mouths?'
translations.idiomatic: The common people have bitter resentments numbering in the tens of thousands. If my lord orders one person to avert it, how can that overcome the voices of the multitude?'

sentences.zh: 是時景公好治宮室，聚狗馬，奢侈，厚賦重刑，故晏子以此諫之。

translations.literal: At this time Jing Gong fond of building palaces, gathered dogs horses, extravagant, heavy taxes severe punishments, therefore Yan Zi with this admonished him.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Duke Jing loved building palaces, gathered dogs and horses, was extravagant, levied heavy taxes and severe punishments. Therefore Yan Zi admonished him with these words.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，吳王闔閭伐楚，入郢。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, Wu Wang He Lu attacked Chu, entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, King He Lu of Wu attacked Chu and entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，魯陽虎攻其君，不勝，奔齊，請齊伐魯。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, Lu Yang Hu attacked his lord, not victorious, fled to Qi, requested Qi attack Lu.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-seventh year, Yang Hu of Lu attacked his lord but failed. He fled to Qi and requested that Qi attack Lu.

sentences.zh: 鮑子諫景公，乃囚陽虎。

translations.literal: Bao Zi admonished Jing Gong, then imprisoned Yang Hu.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Zi admonished Duke Jing, who then imprisoned Yang Hu.

sentences.zh: 陽虎得亡，奔晉。

translations.literal: Yang Hu got away, fled to Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Hu escaped and fled to Jin.

sentences.zh: 四十八年，與魯定公好會夾谷。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, with Lu Ding Gong friendly meeting Jia Gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-eighth year, Duke Jing met amicably with Duke Ding of Lu at Jia Gu.

sentences.zh: 犁鉏曰：「孔丘知禮而怯，請令萊人為樂，因執魯君，可得志。」

translations.literal: Li Chu said: 'Kong Qiu knows rites but cowardly, please order Lai people perform music, thereby seize Lu ruler, can obtain ambition.'
translations.idiomatic: Li Chu said: 'Kong Qiu understands ritual but is cowardly. Please order the Lai people to perform music, then seize the Lu ruler—we can achieve our ambitions.'

sentences.zh: 景公害孔丘相魯，懼其霸，故從犁鉏之計。

translations.literal: Jing Gong resented Kong Qiu assisted Lu, feared his hegemony, therefore followed Li Chu's plan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing resented that Kong Qiu was assisting Lu and feared his potential for hegemony, so he followed Li Chu's plan.

sentences.zh: 方會，進萊樂，孔子歷階上，使有司執萊人斬之，以禮讓景公。

translations.literal: Just meeting, advanced Lai music, Kong Qiu ascended steps, made officials seize Lai people execute them, with ritual reproached Jing Gong.
translations.idiomatic: As the meeting began and the Lai music was performed, Kong Qiu ascended the steps and ordered officials to seize and execute the Lai performers, using ritual to reproach Duke Jing.

sentences.zh: 景公慚，乃歸魯侵地以謝，而罷去。

translations.literal: Jing Gong ashamed, then returned Lu invaded lands to apologize, and withdrew.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing was ashamed, so he returned the invaded Lu territories as an apology and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 是歲，晏嬰卒。

translations.literal: This year, Yan Ying died.
translations.idiomatic: This year, Yan Ying died.

sentences.zh: 五十五年，范、中行反其君於晉，晉攻之急，來請粟。

translations.literal: Fifty-fifth year, Fan, Zhong Xing rebelled against their lord in Jin, Jin attacked them urgently, came requested grain.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-fifth year, the Fan and Zhong Xing families rebelled against their lord in Jin. Jin attacked them fiercely, and they came requesting grain from Qi.

sentences.zh: 田乞欲為亂，樹黨於逆臣，說景公曰：「范、中行數有德於齊，不可不救。」

translations.literal: Tian Qi wished for chaos, planted factions among rebellious ministers, persuaded Jing Gong said: 'Fan, Zhong Xing several times had virtue toward Qi, cannot not save.'
translations.idiomatic: Tian Qi wanted to create chaos. He built factions among the rebellious ministers and persuaded Duke Jing: 'The Fan and Zhong Xing families have repeatedly shown kindness to Qi. We cannot fail to rescue them.'

sentences.zh: 及使乞救而輸之粟。

translations.literal: And sent Qi rescue and transported grain to them.
translations.idiomatic: So Qi sent Tian Qi to rescue them and transported grain to the Fan and Zhong Xing families.

sentences.zh: 五十八年夏，景公夫人燕姬適子死。

translations.literal: Fifty-eighth year summer, Jing Gong wife Yan Ji legitimate son died.
translations.idiomatic: In summer of the fifty-eighth year, Duke Jing's wife Lady Yan's legitimate son died.

sentences.zh: 景公寵妾芮姬生子荼，荼少，其母賤，無行，諸大夫恐其為嗣，乃言願擇諸子長賢者為太子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong favored concubine Rui Ji gave birth to son Tu, Tu young, his mother lowly, without conduct, various grand officers feared him as heir, therefore spoke wished select various sons eldest worthy as crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing's favored concubine Lady Rui gave birth to a son named Tu. Tu was young, his mother was lowly and immoral. The grand officers feared he would become heir, so they spoke of wishing to select the eldest and worthiest of Duke Jing's sons as crown prince.

sentences.zh: 景公老，惡言嗣事，又愛荼母，欲立之，憚發之口，乃謂諸大夫曰：「為樂耳，國何患無君乎？」

translations.literal: Jing Gong old, hated speaking succession matters, moreover loved Tu's mother, wished establish him, dreaded opening mouth, therefore told various grand officers said: 'Just for pleasure, state what worry no ruler?'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing was old and disliked speaking about succession. He also loved Tu's mother and wanted to establish Tu as heir, but he dreaded bringing it up. So he told the grand officers: 'This is just for amusement. Why worry that the state won't have a ruler?'

sentences.zh: 秋，景公病，命國惠子、高昭子立少子荼為太子，逐群公子，遷之萊。

translations.literal: Autumn, Jing Gong ill, commanded Guo Hui Zi, Gao Zhao Zi establish youngest son Tu as crown prince, drove away group princes, moved them to Lai.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Duke Jing fell ill. He commanded Guo Hui Zi and Gao Zhao Zi to establish his youngest son Tu as crown prince, drove away all the other princes, and exiled them to Lai.

sentences.zh: 景公卒，太子荼立，是為晏孺子。

translations.literal: Jing Gong died, crown prince Tu established, this was Yan Ru Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jing died, and Crown Prince Tu ascended the throne, becoming Yan Ruzi.

sentences.zh: 冬，未葬，而群公子畏誅，皆出亡。

translations.literal: Winter, not yet buried, and group princes feared execution, all fled away.
translations.idiomatic: In winter, before Duke Jing was even buried, all the princes fled in fear of execution.

sentences.zh: 荼諸異母兄公子壽、駒、黔奔衛，公子駔、陽生奔魯。

translations.literal: Tu's various different mother elder brothers prince Shou, Ju, Qian fled to Wei, prince Zhu, Yang Sheng fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Tu's half-brothers—the princes Shou, Ju, and Qian—fled to Wei, while the princes Zhu and Yang Sheng fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 萊人歌之曰：「景公死乎弗與埋，三軍事乎弗與謀，師乎師乎，胡黨之乎？」

translations.literal: Lai people sang it said: 'Jing Gong died not with bury, three armies matters not with plot, army army, why follow it?'
translations.idiomatic: The people of Lai sang: 'Duke Jing died but we weren't involved in his burial. Military matters weren't discussed with us. Army, oh army, why should we follow you?'

sentences.zh: 晏孺子元年春，田乞偽事高、國者，每朝，乞驂乘，言曰：「子得君，大夫皆自危，欲謀作亂。」

translations.literal: Yan Ru Zi first year spring, Tian Qi falsely served Gao, Guo people, every court, Qi secondary chariot, said: 'You got ruler, grand officers all self-danger, wish plot make chaos.'
translations.idiomatic: In spring of Yan Ruzi's first year, Tian Qi pretended to serve the Gao and Guo families. At every court session, he rode as secondary charioteer and said: 'You have the ruler, but all the grand officers feel endangered and want to plot rebellion.'

sentences.zh: 又謂諸大夫曰：「高昭子可畏，及未發，先之。」

translations.literal: Again told various grand officers said: 'Gao Zhao Zi fearful, reach before not issued, strike first.'
translations.idiomatic: He also told the grand officers: 'Gao Zhao Zi is dangerous. Before he acts, we should strike first.'

sentences.zh: 大夫從之。

translations.literal: Grand officers followed it.
translations.idiomatic: The grand officers agreed.

sentences.zh: 六月，田乞、鮑牧乃與大夫以兵入公宮，攻高昭子。

translations.literal: Sixth month, Tian Qi, Bao Mu then with grand officers with troops entered duke palace, attacked Gao Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, Tian Qi and Bao Mu, together with the grand officers, entered the ducal palace with troops and attacked Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 昭子聞之，與國惠子救公。

translations.literal: Zhao Zi heard it, with Guo Hui Zi rescued duke.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zhao Zi heard of it and, together with Guo Hui Zi, went to rescue the duke.

sentences.zh: 公師敗，田乞之徒追之，國惠子奔莒，遂反殺高昭子。

translations.literal: Duke troops defeated, Tian Qi's followers pursued them, Guo Hui Zi fled to Ju, then turned back killed Gao Zhao Zi.
translations.idiomatic: The duke's forces were defeated. Tian Qi's followers pursued them. Guo Hui Zi fled to Ju, but they turned back and killed Gao Zhao Zi.

sentences.zh: 晏圉奔魯。

translations.literal: Yan Yu fled to Lu.
translations.idiomatic: Yan Yu fled to Lu.

sentences.zh: 八月，齊秉意茲。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Qi took Yi Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, Qi seized Yi Zi.

sentences.zh: 田乞敗二相，乃使人之魯召公子陽生。

translations.literal: Tian Qi defeated two chancellors, then sent people to Lu summoned prince Yang Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: After Tian Qi defeated the two chancellors, he sent people to Lu to summon Prince Yang Sheng.

sentences.zh: 陽生至齊，私匿田乞家。

translations.literal: Yang Sheng arrived at Qi, secretly hid in Tian Qi home.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Sheng arrived in Qi and secretly hid in Tian Qi's home.

sentences.zh: 十月戊子，田乞請諸大夫曰：「常之母有魚菽之祭，幸來會飲。」

translations.literal: Tenth month wu zi, Tian Qi invited various grand officers said: 'Chang's mother has fish bean sacrifice, fortunate come gather drink.'
translations.idiomatic: On the wu zi day of the tenth month, Tian Qi invited all the grand officers: 'My wife has a fish and bean sacrifice. Please come join the drinking gathering.'

sentences.zh: 會飲，田乞盛陽生橐中，置坐中央，發橐出陽生，曰：「此乃齊君矣！」

translations.literal: Gathered drinking, Tian Qi put Yang Sheng in bag, placed seat central, opened bag out Yang Sheng, said: 'This is Qi ruler!'
translations.idiomatic: At the drinking gathering, Tian Qi hid Yang Sheng in a bag and placed it in the center of the seats. He opened the bag and Yang Sheng emerged, declaring: 'This is the ruler of Qi!'

sentences.zh: 大夫皆伏謁。

translations.literal: Grand officers all prostrated greeted.
translations.idiomatic: All the grand officers prostrated themselves and greeted him.

sentences.zh: 將與大夫盟而立之，鮑牧醉，乞誣大夫曰：「吾與鮑牧謀共立陽生。」

translations.literal: About to with grand officers covenant establish him, Bao Mu drunk, Qi slandered grand officers said: 'I with Bao Mu plotted together establish Yang Sheng.'
translations.idiomatic: As they were about to make a covenant with the grand officers and establish him, Bao Mu got drunk. Tian Qi slandered him to the grand officers: 'Bao Mu and I plotted together to establish Yang Sheng.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧怒曰：「子忘景公之命乎？」

translations.literal: Bao Mu angry said: 'You forget Jing Gong's command?'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu angrily said: 'Have you forgotten Duke Jing's command?'

sentences.zh: 諸大夫相視欲悔，陽生前，頓首曰：「可則立之，否則已。」

translations.literal: Various grand officers mutually looked wished regret, Yang Sheng forward, kowtowed said: 'Can then establish him, no then stop.'
translations.idiomatic: The grand officers looked at each other and wanted to back out. Yang Sheng stepped forward and kowtowed: 'If you can accept me, then establish me as ruler. If not, then stop.'

sentences.zh: 鮑牧恐禍起，乃復曰：「皆景公子也，何為不可！」

translations.literal: Bao Mu feared disaster arise, then again said: 'All Jing Gong sons, why cannot!'
translations.idiomatic: Bao Mu feared disaster would arise, so he said: 'They are all sons of Duke Jing. Why not?'

sentences.zh: 乃與盟，立陽生，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Then with covenant, established Yang Sheng, this was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: They made a covenant and established Yang Sheng as ruler, who became Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公入宮，使人遷晏孺子於駘，殺之幕下，而逐孺子母芮子。

translations.literal: Dao Gong entered palace, made people move Yan Ru Zi to Dai, killed him under tent, and drove away Ru Zi mother Rui Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao entered the palace and had people move Yan Ruzi to Dai, where he was killed beneath a tent. He also expelled Yan Ruzi's mother, Lady Rui.

sentences.zh: 芮子故賤而孺子少，故無權，國人輕之。

translations.literal: Rui Zi originally lowly and Ru Zi young, therefore no authority, state people despised him.
translations.idiomatic: Lady Rui was originally of low status and Yan Ruzi was young, so he had no real authority. The people of the state despised him.

sentences.zh: 悼公元年，齊伐魯，取讙、闡。

translations.literal: Dao Gong first year, Qi attacked Lu, took Huan, Chan.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Dao's first year, Qi attacked Lu and captured Huan and Chan.

sentences.zh: 初，陽生亡在魯，季康子以其妹妻之。

translations.literal: Initially, Yang Sheng fled in Lu, Ji Kang Zi with his younger sister married him.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, when Yang Sheng was in exile in Lu, Ji Kang Zi married his younger sister to him.

sentences.zh: 及歸即位，使迎之。

translations.literal: When returned ascended throne, made welcome her.
translations.idiomatic: When he returned and ascended the throne, he sent for her.

sentences.zh: 季姬與季魴侯通，言其情，魯弗敢與，故齊伐魯，竟迎季姬。

translations.literal: Ji Ji with Ji Pang Hou had relations, spoke their affair, Lu dared not give, therefore Qi attacked Lu, finally welcomed Ji Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ji was having an affair with Ji Pang Hou and spoke of their relationship. Lu dared not give her up, so Qi attacked Lu and finally retrieved Ji Ji.

sentences.zh: 季姬嬖，齊復歸魯侵地。

translations.literal: Ji Ji favored, Qi again returned Lu invaded lands.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Ji was favored, so Qi returned the lands it had taken from Lu.

sentences.zh: 鮑子與悼公有郤，不善。

translations.literal: Bao Zi with Dao Gong had enmity, not good.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Zi had enmity with Duke Dao and relations were poor.

sentences.zh: 四年，吳、魯伐齊南方。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Wu, Lu attacked Qi southern areas.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Wu and Lu attacked Qi's southern territories.

sentences.zh: 鮑子弒悼公，赴于吳。

translations.literal: Bao Zi assassinated Dao Gong, reported to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Bao Zi assassinated Duke Dao and reported it to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳王夫差哭於軍門外三日，將從海入討齊。

translations.literal: Wu Wang Fu Chai wept at army gate outside three days, about to from sea enter punish Qi.
translations.idiomatic: King Fu Chai of Wu wept outside the army gate for three days and was about to enter by sea to punish Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊人敗之，吳師乃去。

translations.literal: Qi people defeated them, Wu troops then departed.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi defeated them, and the Wu troops withdrew.

sentences.zh: 晉趙鞅伐齊，至賴而去。

translations.literal: Jin Zhao Yang attacked Qi, arrived at Lai and departed.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Yang of Jin attacked Qi, reached Lai, and withdrew.

sentences.zh: 齊人共立悼公子壬，是為簡公。

translations.literal: Qi people together established Dao Gong son Ren, this was Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi together established Dao Gong's son Ren as ruler, who became Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 簡公四年春，初，簡公與父陽生俱在魯也，監止有寵焉。

translations.literal: Jian Gong fourth year spring, initially, Jian Gong with father Yang Sheng both in Lu, Jian Zhi had favor there.
translations.idiomatic: In spring of Duke Jian's fourth year: originally, when Duke Jian and his father Yang Sheng were both in Lu, Jian Zhi was favored.

sentences.zh: 及即位，使為政。

translations.literal: When ascended throne, made administer government.
translations.idiomatic: When he ascended the throne, he put Jian Zhi in charge of government.

sentences.zh: 田成子憚之，驟顧於朝。

translations.literal: Tian Cheng Zi feared him, frequently looked back at court.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Cheng Zi feared him and frequently looked back anxiously at court.

sentences.zh: 御鞅言簡公曰：「田、監不可并也，君其擇焉。」

translations.literal: Yu Yang spoke to Jian Gong said: 'Tian, Jian cannot exist together, lord should choose one.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu Yang spoke to Duke Jian: 'Tian and Jian cannot coexist. My lord should choose between them.'

sentences.zh: 弗聽。

translations.literal: Did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen.

sentences.zh: 子我夕，田逆殺人，逢之，遂捕以入。

translations.literal: Zi Wo evening, Tian Ni killed person, encountered him, then captured to enter.
translations.idiomatic: In the evening, Zi Wo encountered Tian Ni who had killed someone. He captured him and brought him in.

sentences.zh: 田氏方睦，使囚病而遺守囚者酒，醉而殺守者，得亡。

translations.literal: Tian family just harmonious, made prisoner feign illness and sent guard prisoner wine, drunk and killed guard, got to flee.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian family was harmonious. They made the prisoner feign illness and sent wine to the guard. When the guard got drunk, they killed him and escaped.

sentences.zh: 子我盟諸田於陳宗。

translations.literal: Zi Wo covenanted various Tian at Chen Zong.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo made a covenant with the various Tian family members at Chen Zong.

sentences.zh: 初，田豹欲為子我臣，使公孫言豹，豹有喪而止。

translations.literal: Initially, Tian Bao wished serve Zi Wo minister, made Gong Sun speak to Bao, Bao had mourning and stopped.
translations.idiomatic: Originally, Tian Bao wanted to serve as Zi Wo's minister. He had Gong Sun speak to Bao about it, but Bao had mourning obligations and declined.

sentences.zh: 後卒以為臣，幸於子我。

translations.literal: Later finally became minister, favored by Zi Wo.
translations.idiomatic: Later he finally became a minister and was favored by Zi Wo.

sentences.zh: 子我謂曰：「吾盡逐田氏而立女，可乎？」

translations.literal: Zi Wo told him said: 'I completely drive out Tian family and establish you, can?'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo said to him: 'I will completely drive out the Tian family and establish you. Is that acceptable?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「我遠田氏矣。

translations.literal: Replied said: 'I distant from Tian family.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied: 'I am distant from the Tian family.'

sentences.zh: 且其違者不過數人，何盡逐焉！」

translations.literal: Moreover those who oppose only several people, why completely drive out!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, those who oppose you are only a few people. Why drive them all out?'

sentences.zh: 遂告田氏。

translations.literal: Then informed Tian family.
translations.idiomatic: So he informed the Tian family.

sentences.zh: 子行曰：「彼得君，弗先，必禍子。」

translations.literal: Zi Xing said: 'If he gets ruler, not first, certainly disaster you.'
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xing said: 'If he gets the ruler first, it will certainly bring disaster to you.'

sentences.zh: 子行舍於公宮。

translations.literal: Zi Xing lodged at duke palace.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xing took up residence in the ducal palace.

sentences.zh: 夏五月壬申，成子兄弟四乘如公。

translations.literal: Summer fifth month ren shen, Cheng Zi brothers four chariots went to duke.
translations.idiomatic: On the ren shen day of the fifth month in summer, Cheng Zi and his three brothers went to the duke in four chariots.

sentences.zh: 子我在幄，出迎之，遂入，閉門。

translations.literal: Zi Wo in tent, came out welcomed them, then entered, closed door.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo was in his tent. He came out to welcome them, then they entered and closed the door.

sentences.zh: 宦者御之，子行殺宦者。

translations.literal: Eunuch drove chariot, Zi Xing killed eunuch.
translations.idiomatic: An eunuch drove the chariot. Zi Xing killed the eunuch.

sentences.zh: 公與婦人飲酒於檀臺，成子遷諸寢。

translations.literal: Duke with woman drinking wine at Tan Platform, Cheng Zi moved them to bedchamber.
translations.idiomatic: The duke was drinking wine with a woman on the Tan Platform when Cheng Zi moved them to the bedchamber.

sentences.zh: 公執戈將擊之，太史子餘曰：「非不利也，將除害也。」

translations.literal: Duke grasped spear about to strike him, Grand Historian Zi Yu said: 'Not disadvantage, about to remove harm.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke grasped a spear and was about to strike him when Grand Historian Zi Yu said: 'This is not disadvantageous. He is about to remove a threat.'

sentences.zh: 成子出舍于庫，聞公猶怒，將出，曰：「何所無君！」

translations.literal: Cheng Zi came out lodged at treasury, heard duke still angry, about to leave, said: 'What place without ruler!'
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Zi came out and took lodging at the treasury. Hearing that the duke was still angry, he was about to leave and said: 'What place doesn't have a ruler!'

sentences.zh: 子行拔劍曰：「需，事之賊也。

translations.literal: Zi Xing drew sword said: 'Delay, affairs' thief.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Xing drew his sword and said: 'Delay is the thief of affairs.

sentences.zh: 誰非田宗？

translations.literal: Who not Tian clan?
translations.idiomatic: Who is not of the Tian clan?

sentences.zh: 所不殺子者有如田宗。」

translations.literal: What not kill you have like Tian clan.'
translations.idiomatic: If I do not kill you, may the Tian clan be my witness.'

sentences.zh: 乃止。

translations.literal: Then stopped.
translations.idiomatic: So he stopped.

sentences.zh: 子我歸，屬徒攻闈與大門，皆弗勝，乃出。

translations.literal: Zi Wo returned, gathered followers attacked inner gate and great gate, all not victorious, then left.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Wo returned and gathered his followers to attack the inner gate and main gate, but they could not prevail, so he left.

sentences.zh: 田氏追之。

translations.literal: Tian family pursued him.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian family pursued him.

sentences.zh: 豐丘人執子我以告，殺之郭關。

translations.literal: Feng Qiu people seized Zi Wo to report, killed him at outer gate.
translations.idiomatic: People from Feng Qiu seized Zi Wo and reported it. He was killed at the outer gate.

sentences.zh: 成子將殺大陸子方，田逆請而免之。

translations.literal: Cheng Zi about to kill Da Lu Zi Fang, Tian Ni requested and exempted him.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Zi was about to kill Da Lu Zi Fang, but Tian Ni interceded and spared him.

sentences.zh: 以公命取車於道，出雍門。

translations.literal: With duke command took chariot from road, exited Yong Gate.
translations.idiomatic: On the duke's command, he took a chariot from the road and exited through Yong Gate.

sentences.zh: 田豹與之車，弗受，曰：「逆為余請，豹與余車，余有私焉。

translations.literal: Tian Bao gave him chariot, did not accept, said: 'Ni requested for me, Bao gave me chariot, I have private relations.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Bao offered him a chariot, but he refused, saying: 'Ni interceded for me, Bao gives me a chariot—I have private dealings with them.

sentences.zh: 事子我而有私於其讎，何以見魯、衛之士？」

translations.literal: Serve Zi Wo and have private with his enemy, how to see Lu, Wei scholars?'
translations.idiomatic: To serve Zi Wo yet have private dealings with his enemies—how can I face the scholars of Lu and Wei?'

sentences.zh: 庚辰，田常執簡公于俆州。

translations.literal: Geng chen, Tian Chang seized Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: On geng chen day, Tian Chang seized Duke Jian at Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 公曰：「余蚤從御鞅言，不及此。」

translations.literal: Duke said: 'I early followed Yu Yang words, not reach this.'
translations.idiomatic: The duke said: 'If only I had followed Yu Yang's advice earlier, I would not have come to this.'

sentences.zh: 甲午，田常弒簡公于俆州。

translations.literal: Jia wu, Tian Chang assassinated Jian Gong at Xu Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: On jia wu day, Tian Chang assassinated Duke Jian at Xu Zhou.

sentences.zh: 田常乃立簡公弟驁，是為平公。

translations.literal: Tian Chang then established Jian Gong younger brother Ao, this was Ping Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Chang then established Duke Jian's younger brother Ao as ruler, who became Duke Ping.

sentences.zh: 平公即位，田常相之，專齊之政，割齊安平以東為田氏封邑。

translations.literal: Ping Gong ascended throne, Tian Chang chancellor him, monopolized Qi government, divided Qi An Ping east as Tian family fief.
translations.idiomatic: When Duke Ping ascended the throne, Tian Chang became his chancellor, monopolized Qi's government, and divided the territory east of An Ping as the Tian family's fief.

sentences.zh: 平公八年，越滅吳。

translations.literal: Ping Gong eighth year, Yue extinguished Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's eighth year, Yue extinguished Wu.

sentences.zh: 二十五年卒，子宣公積立。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year died, son Xuan Gong Ji established.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the twenty-fifth year, and his son Duke Xuan (Ji) succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 宣公五十一年卒，子康公貸立。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong fifty-first year died, son Kang Gong Dai established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died in his fifty-first year, and his son Duke Kang (Dai) succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 田會反廩丘。

translations.literal: Tian Hui rebelled Lin Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Hui rebelled at Lin Qiu.

sentences.zh: 康公二年，韓、魏、趙始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Kang Gong second year, Han, Wei, Zhao began ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Kang's second year, Han, Wei, and Zhao first became recognized as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十九年，田常曾孫田和始為諸侯，遷康公海濱。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Tian Chang great-grandson Tian He began as feudal lord, moved Kang Gong seaside.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Tian Chang's great-grandson Tian He became a feudal lord and relocated Duke Kang to the seaside.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，康公卒，呂氏遂絕其祀。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, Kang Gong died, Lu family then extinguished their sacrifices.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, Duke Kang died, and the Lu family line was extinguished.

sentences.zh: 田氏卒有齊國，為齊威王，彊於天下。

translations.literal: Tian family finally possessed Qi state, became Qi Wei Wang, strong in the world.
translations.idiomatic: The Tian family finally possessed the state of Qi, becoming King Wei of Qi, powerful throughout the world.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：吾適齊，自泰山屬之瑯邪，北被于海，膏壤二千里，其民闊達多匿知，其天性也。

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: I went to Qi, from Tai Shan connected to Lang Ya, north covered to sea, fertile soil two thousand li, its people broad-minded many concealed wisdom, their natural character.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: I traveled to Qi, from Mount Tai extending to Langya, northward reaching the sea, with fertile soil for two thousand li. Its people are broad-minded and conceal much wisdom—this is their natural character.

sentences.zh: 以太公之聖，建國本，桓公之盛，修善政，以為諸侯會盟，稱伯，不亦宜乎？

translations.literal: With Tai Gong's sageliness, established state foundation, Huan Gong's flourishing, cultivated good government, to make feudal lords assemble ally, called hegemon, not also fitting?
translations.idiomatic: With the sageliness of the Grand Duke establishing the state's foundation, and Duke Huan's flourishing cultivation of good government, enabling him to convene the feudal lords in alliance and be called hegemon—was this not fitting?

sentences.zh: 洋洋哉，固大國之風也！

translations.literal: Vast ah, indeed great state's manner!
translations.idiomatic: How vast! This is indeed the manner of a great state!
